intro: Pyrrosia rasamalae, commonly known as the Kirirom fern, is a rare and unique species native to Cambodia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows on shaded rock faces or in moist, shaded forest environments. Its fronds are leathery and have a distinctive, intricate pattern of veins. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
